coreCitation.title: Historic Boston Shoreline
coreCitation.shortDataDescription: Collection of data files depicting Boston's historic shoreline across various years.
coreCitation.shortGenealogyDescription: These files were created by manually 'digitizing' or  creating vector features from a collectin of born-digital maps held by the Leventhal Map and Education Center. This collection can be accessed here: https://collections.leventhalmap.org/search?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=mapworks . As the original data used to create these maps was not preserved, the geospatial vector data was re-created in 2019, and this collection refers to the data created by that process.
coreCitation.accessCondition: This collection is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use.

temporal.temporalNotes: This data represents the historic state of the Boston shoreline in the year 1916. It was digitally derived in 2019 from born-digital maps published in 1995.

suggestedEntryPoints.title: Historic Shoreline Collection Root Data Folder
suggestedEntryPoints.notes: Root folder of the Historic Shoreline collection

description.missingContext: There is no available context about the process by which this digitization project occurred. The LMEC has made attempts to track down original processes, but have not found any reliable information. We unfortunately do not have any context about how this information was originally created.

actors.name: Herb Heidt, Eliza McClennen, Alex Kreigger, David Cobb and Amy Turner
actors.notes: The original born-digital maps used as a source for this data were created by cartographers Herb Heidt and Eliza McClennen of MapWorks for Mapping Boston edited by Alex Krieger and David Cobb with Amy Turner in 1999. The LMEC, despite hosting these born-digital maps in our digital collections, does not have access to the origial GIS data that was used to produce these source maps in 1999.
actors.missingProcessingInformation: The LMEC has no records on the processing steps used to create the original Mapworks maps.

actors.name: Herb Heidt, Eliza McClennen, Alex Kreigger, David Cobb and Amy Turner
actors.notes: Cartographer Vickie Taylor, as part of Nancy Seasholes' Atlas of Boston History project, re-vectorized the Mapworks maps, creating the 2019 shoreline boundaries described in this record.
actors.missingProcessingInformation: The LMEC has no records on the processing steps used to create the data this record describes.
